name: Facet.Plot

types.name: Plot
types.comment:
A `Plot` allows you to combine several layers of `Encodings` along with
    the corresponding `Legends` and `Axis`.

    In addition, you can specify how the plot should be facetted to create
    [small multiples](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Small_multiple).

types.name: PlotError
types.comment: Reasons why plot compilation may have failed

values.name: compile
values.comment: Compile a plot using the default `Theme`.
values.type: Facet.Plot.Plot data xdomain ydomain facetRow facetColumn -> List data -> Result.Result (List Facet.Plot.PlotError) ( Facet.Scenegraph.ViewBox, Facet.Scenegraph.Scenegraph )

values.name: compileWithTheme
values.comment: Compile a plot with a custom `Theme`.
values.type: Facet.Theme.Theme -> Facet.Plot.Plot data xdomain ydomain facetRow facetColumn -> List data -> Result.Result (List Facet.Plot.PlotError) ( Facet.Scenegraph.ViewBox, Facet.Scenegraph.Scenegraph )

values.name: facetColumn
values.comment:
Generate a column of small multiples using the same scale and axes, allowing
    them to be easily compared.
values.type: { r | column : Facet.Internal.Field.Field data comparableColumn } -> Facet.Plot.Plot data xdomain ydomain a b -> Facet.Plot.Plot data xdomain ydomain a comparableColumn

values.name: facetColumnFormat
values.type: (facetColumn -> String) -> Facet.Plot.Plot data xdomain ydomain facetRow facetColumn -> Facet.Plot.Plot data xdomain ydomain facetRow facetColumn

values.name: facetColumnWrap
values.comment:
Generate columns of small multiples, with a maximum height, using the same
    scale and axes, allowing them to be easily compared.
values.type: { r | column : Facet.Internal.Field.Field data comparableColumn, maxPerColumn : Int } -> Facet.Plot.Plot data xdomain ydomain a b -> Facet.Plot.Plot data xdomain ydomain a comparableColumn

values.name: facetGrid
values.comment:
Generate a grid of small multiples using the same scale and axes
    , allowing them to be easily compared.
values.type: { r | row : Facet.Internal.Field.Field data comparableRow, column : Facet.Internal.Field.Field data comparableColumn } -> Facet.Plot.Plot data xdomain ydomain a b -> Facet.Plot.Plot data xdomain ydomain comparableRow comparableColumn

values.name: facetRow
values.comment:
Generate a row of small multiples using the same scale and axes, allowing
    them to be easily compared.
values.type: { r | row : Facet.Internal.Field.Field data comparableRow } -> Facet.Plot.Plot data xdomain ydomain a b -> Facet.Plot.Plot data xdomain ydomain comparableRow b

values.name: facetRowFormat
values.comment:
Specify how the small multiple labels for each column in a row of
    small multiples should be formatted
values.type: (facetRow -> String) -> Facet.Plot.Plot data xdomain ydomain facetRow facetColumn -> Facet.Plot.Plot data xdomain ydomain facetRow facetColumn

values.name: facetRowWrap
values.comment:
Generate rows of small multiples, with a maximum length, using the same
    scale and axes, allowing them to be easily compared.
values.type: { r | row : Facet.Internal.Field.Field data comparableRow, maxPerRow : Int } -> Facet.Plot.Plot data xdomain ydomain a b -> Facet.Plot.Plot data xdomain ydomain comparableRow b

values.name: height
values.comment: Specify the user-space height of a plot
values.type: Float -> Facet.Plot.Plot data xdomain ydomain facetRow facetColumn -> Facet.Plot.Plot data xdomain ydomain facetRow facetColumn

values.name: layer
values.type: Facet.Internal.Encoding.Encoding data xdomain ydomain -> Facet.Plot.Plot data xdomain ydomain facetRow facetColumn -> Facet.Plot.Plot data xdomain ydomain facetRow facetColumn

values.name: plot
values.comment: An empty `Plot` with an optional title
values.type: Maybe.Maybe String -> Facet.Plot.Plot data xdomain ydomain facetRow facetColumn

values.name: size
values.comment: Specify the user-space width and height of a plot
values.type: Float -> Float -> Facet.Plot.Plot data xdomain ydomain facetRow facetColumn -> Facet.Plot.Plot data xdomain ydomain facetRow facetColumn

values.name: width
values.comment: Specify the user-space width of a plot
values.type: Float -> Facet.Plot.Plot data xdomain ydomain facetRow facetColumn -> Facet.Plot.Plot data xdomain ydomain facetRow facetColumn

values.name: xAxis
values.type: Facet.Axis.Axis Facet.Internal.Axis.Vertical xdomain -> Facet.Plot.Plot data xdomain ydomain facetRow facetColumn -> Facet.Plot.Plot data xdomain ydomain facetRow facetColumn

values.name: yAxis
values.type: Facet.Axis.Axis Facet.Internal.Axis.Horizontal ydomain -> Facet.Plot.Plot data xdomain ydomain facetRow facetColumn -> Facet.Plot.Plot data xdomain ydomain facetRow facetColumn

name: Facet.Encoding

aliases.name: Encoding
aliases.comment:
# Encoding

    An `Encoding` is a means of encoding data as visual mark by combining
    several `Channel`s to represent variaus attributes of that visual mark.

    A description of each encoding along with the required and optional `Channels`
    is given below.

    ## Arc

    A cicular arc.

    ### Required channels

    - x position (`PositionalChannel`)
    - y position (`PositionalChannel`)
    - start angle in Radians (`FloatChannel`)
    - end angle in Radians (`FloatChannel`)
    - outer radius in user-space pixels (`FloatChannel`)

    ### Optional channels

    - inner radius in user-space pixels (`FloatChannel`)
    - corner radius in user-space pixels (`FloatChannel`)
    - fill color (`ColorChannel`)
    - fill opacity, between 0 and 1 (`FloatChannel`)
    - stroke color (`ColorChannel`)
    - stroke opacity, between 0 and 1 (`FloatChannel`)
    - stroke width in user-space pixels (`FloatChannel`)
    - stroke dash (`StrokeDashChannel`)
    - tooltip (`TextChannel`)

    ## Area

    Filled area with either vertical or horizontal orientation.

    ### Required channels

    - x positions (`PositionalChannel`)
    - y positions (`PositionalChannel`)

    You must also provide an interpolation method and the preferred behaviour
    when missing values are encountered

    ### Optional channels

    - fill color (`ColorChannel`)
    - fill opacity, between 0 and 1 (`FloatChannel`)
    - stroke color (`ColorChannel`)
    - stroke opacity, between 0 and 1 (`FloatChannel`)
    - stroke width in user-space pixels (`FloatChannel`)
    - stroke dash (`StrokeDashChannel`)
    - tooltip (`TextChannel`)

    ## Line

    Stroked lines.

    ### Required channels

    - x positions (`PositionalChannel`)
    - y positions (`PositionalChannel`)

    You must also provide an interpolation method and the preferred behaviour
    when missing values are encountered

    ### Optional channels

    - stroke color (`ColorChannel`)
    - stroke opacity, between 0 and 1 (`FloatChannel`)
    - stroke width in user-space pixels (`FloatChannel`)
    - stroke dash (`StrokeDashChannel`)
    - tooltip (`TextChannel`)

    ## Polygon

    Arbitrary filled polygons.

    ### Required channels

    - x positions (`PositionalChannel`)
    - y positions (`PositionalChannel`)

    You must also provide an interpolation method and the preferred behaviour
    when missing values are encountered

    ### Optional channels

    - fill color (`ColorChannel`)
    - fill opacity, between 0 and 1 (`FloatChannel`)
    - stroke color (`ColorChannel`)
    - stroke opacity, between 0 and 1 (`FloatChannel`)
    - stroke width in user-space pixels (`FloatChannel`)
    - stroke dash (`StrokeDashChannel`)
    - tooltip (`TextChannel`)

    ## Rect

    Filled rectangles.

    ### Required channels

    Either
    - primary and secondary x and y positions
    or
    - primary x and y positions, width and height

    ### Optional channels

    - corner radius in user-space pixels (`FloatChannel`)
    - fill color (`ColorChannel`)
    - fill opacity, between 0 and 1 (`FloatChannel`)
    - stroke color (`ColorChannel`)
    - stroke opacity, between 0 and 1 (`FloatChannel`)
    - stroke width in user-space pixels (`FloatChannel`)
    - stroke dash (`StrokeDashChannel`)
    - tooltip (`TextChannel`)

    ## Rule

    Strkoed line segments.

    ### Required channels

    - primary and secondary x positions (`PositionalChannel`)
    - primary and secondary y positions (`PositionalChannel`)

    ### Optional channels

    - stroke color (`ColorChannel`)
    - stroke opacity, between 0 and 1 (`FloatChannel`)
    - stroke width in user-space pixels (`FloatChannel`)
    - stroke dash (`StrokeDashChannel`)
    - tooltip (`TextChannel`)

    ## Symbol

    Plotting symbols, including circles, squares and other shapes.

    ### Required channels

    - shape (`ShapeChannel`)
    - x position (`PositionalChannel`)
    - y position (`PositionalChannel`)

    ### Optional channels

    - size in user-space pixels squared (`FloatChannel`)
    - angle in Radians (`FloatChannel`)
    - fill color (`ColorChannel`)
    - fill opacity, between 0 and 1 (`FloatChannel`)
    - stroke color (`ColorChannel`)
    - stroke opacity, between 0 and 1 (`FloatChannel`)
    - stroke width in user-space pixels (`FloatChannel`)
    - stroke dash (`StrokeDashChannel`)
    - tooltip (`TextChannel`)

    ## Text

    Text labels with configurable fonts, alignment and angle.

    ### Required Channels

    - text (`TextChannel`)
    - x position (`PositionalChannel`)
    - y position (`PositionalChannel`)


    ### Optional channels

    - size in user-space pixels squared (`FloatChannel`)
    - angle in Radians (`FloatChannel`)
    - fill color (`ColorChannel`)
    - fill opacity, between 0 and 1 (`FloatChannel`)
    - stroke color (`ColorChannel`)
    - stroke opacity, between 0 and 1 (`FloatChannel`)
    - stroke width in user-space pixels (`FloatChannel`)
    - stroke dash (`StrokeDashChannel`)
    - tooltip (`TextChannel`)

    ## Trail

    Filled lines with varying width.

    ### Required Channels

    - widths (`FloatChannel`)
    - x positions (`PositionalChannel`)
    - y positions (`PositionalChannel`)


    ### Optional channels

    - fill color (`ColorChannel`)
    - fill opacity, between 0 and 1 (`FloatChannel`)
    - tooltip (`TextChannel`)

name: Facet.Channel

aliases.name: AngleChannel
aliases.comment: An `AngleChannel` is used to encode data as the rotation of a visual mark.

aliases.name: ColorChannel
aliases.comment:
A `ColorChannel` is used to encode data as either the fill color or stroke color
of a visual mark.

aliases.name: FloatChannel
aliases.comment:
A `FloatChannel` is used to encode data as some non-positional numeric attribute
of a visual mark e.g. stroke width, size, font size.

aliases.name: IntChannel
aliases.comment:
A `IntChannel` is used to encode data as some non-positional numeric attribute
of a visual mark e.g. stroke width, size, font size.

aliases.name: PositionalChannel
aliases.comment:
A `PositionalChannel` is used to associate a data value with a position on either
the x- or y-axis.

aliases.name: ShapeChannel
aliases.comment:
A `ShapeChannel` is used to encode data as the shape used in a `Symbol` visual
mark.

aliases.name: StrokeDashChannel
aliases.comment:
A `StrokeDashChannel` is used to encode data as the stroke dash array
and (optional) stroke dash offset of a visual mark.

aliases.name: TextChannel
aliases.comment:
A `TextChannel` is used to encode data as the text of a `Text` mark or as the
tooltip of any visual mark.

name: Facet.Axis

aliases.name: Axis
aliases.comment: An `Axis` is a special type of `Legend` for positional channels

values.name: bandX
values.comment: Create an x-axis with a band scale from a comparable domain
values.type: Maybe.Maybe String -> Facet.Internal.Axis.Axis Facet.Axis.Vertical comparableDomain

values.name: bandY
values.comment: Create a y-axis with a band scale from a comparable domain
values.type: Maybe.Maybe String -> Facet.Internal.Axis.Axis Facet.Axis.Horizontal comparableDomain

values.name: continuousDomain
values.type: ( domain, domain ) -> Facet.Axis.Axis orientation domain -> Facet.Axis.Axis orientation domain

values.name: continuousScale
values.type: (( domain, domain ) -> ( Float, Float ) -> Facet.Scale.Scale domain Float) -> Facet.Axis.Axis orientation domain -> Facet.Axis.Axis orientation domain

values.name: continuousX
values.comment:
Create an x-axis with a continuous domain, defined by an upper and lower
    limit.
values.type: { r | title : Maybe.Maybe String, scale : ( xdomain, xdomain ) -> ( Float, Float ) -> Facet.Scale.Scale xdomain Float } -> Facet.Axis.Axis Facet.Axis.Vertical xdomain

values.name: continuousY
values.comment:
Create a y-axis with a continuos domain, defined by an upper and lower
    limit.
values.type: { r | title : Maybe.Maybe String, scale : ( ydomain, ydomain ) -> ( Float, Float ) -> Facet.Scale.Scale ydomain Float } -> Facet.Axis.Axis Facet.Axis.Horizontal ydomain

values.name: customBandX
values.comment: Create an x-axis with a band scale from an arbitrary domain
values.type: Maybe.Maybe String -> Facet.Internal.Axis.Axis Facet.Axis.Vertical anyDomain

values.name: customBandY
values.type: Maybe.Maybe String -> Facet.Internal.Axis.Axis Facet.Axis.Horizontal anyDomain

values.name: discreteX
values.comment:
Create an x-axis with a discrete domain, defined by the list of elements
    in the domain.
values.type: { r | title : Maybe.Maybe String, scale : List xdomain -> ( Float, Float ) -> Facet.Scale.Scale xdomain Float } -> Facet.Axis.Axis Facet.Axis.Vertical xdomain

values.name: discreteY
values.comment:
Create an x-axis with a discrete domain, explicitly providing a function
    to construct an ordinal scale
values.type: { r | title : Maybe.Maybe String, scale : List ydomain -> ( Float, Float ) -> Facet.Scale.Scale ydomain Float } -> Facet.Axis.Axis Facet.Axis.Horizontal ydomain

name: Facet.Scale

types.name: Scale
types.comment:
A scale provides a means of mapping between values of type _domain_ to
    values of type _range_.

name: Facet.Field

aliases.name: Field
aliases.comment:
A `Field` is a means of extracting a value from some data type.

    There are different `Field`s allowing you to extract different 'shapes'
    of data:
    - A scalar `Field` extracts single item from a single piece of data;
    - A vector `Field` extracts a list of items from a list of data;
    - An aggregate `Field` summarizes a list of data as a single item.

    In addition, each type of field supports situations where the item you
    are extracting may be missing.

values.name: aggregate
values.type: { a | name : Maybe.Maybe String, extract : List data -> domain } -> Facet.Field.Field data domain

values.name: constant
values.type: domain -> Facet.Field.Field data domain

values.name: maybeAggregate
values.type: { a | name : Maybe.Maybe String, extract : List data -> Maybe.Maybe domain } -> Facet.Field.Field data domain

values.name: maybeScalar
values.type: { a | name : Maybe.Maybe String, extract : data -> Maybe.Maybe domain } -> Facet.Field.Field data domain

values.name: maybeVector
values.type: { a | name : Maybe.Maybe String, extract : List data -> List (Maybe.Maybe domain) } -> Facet.Field.Field data domain

values.name: scalar
values.type: { name : Maybe.Maybe String, extract : data -> domain } -> Facet.Field.Field data domain

values.name: vector
values.type: { a | name : Maybe.Maybe String, extract : List data -> List domain } -> Facet.Field.Field data domain
